tModLoader.LoadWarningBannerOrBannerItemNotSet: {0}: {1}. You have set ModNPC.banner or ModNPC.bannerItem, but not the other. Make sure you set both, check your spelling, and that the item exists if you are using mod.ItemType(). Report this to the {0} developers.
tModLoader.UnloadError: One or more errors occured while unloading and tModLoader must be restarted to prevent further issues.
tModLoader.DefensiveUnload: {0} was unable to unload properly. Modders must use defensive programming to ensure unloading completes regardless of any errors during loading.

tModLoader.BuildErrorModCompileFolderHint: It is likely that you didn't install correctly. Make sure you installed the ModCompile folder as well.
tModLoader.BuildErrorMissingDllFiles:
Missing dll files for noCompile: {0}

Must have either All.dll or both of Windows.dll and Mono.dll
All.dll must not have any references to Microsoft.Xna.Framework or FNA
Windows.dll must reference the windows Terraria.exe and Microsoft.Xna.Framework.dll
Mono.dll must reference a non-windows Terraria.exe and FNA.dll
tModLoader.BuildErrorModNameDoesntMatchAssemblyName: Mod name {0} does not match assembly name {1}
tModLoader.BuildErrorNamespaceFolderDontMatch: Namespace and Folder name do not match. The top level namespace must match the folder name.
tModLoader.BuildErrorNoModClass: Make sure you have exactly one class extending Mod.

tModLoader.MBOfflineTroubleshooting:
The Mod Browser can't be reached, this can be due to many reasons.
 1. Check your Internet connection.
 2. The Mod Browser might just be offline. If it worked before, just wait a few hours.
 3. Double-click this message to open the Mod Browser website. You can use this to manually download mods. If this works, you should check your firewall to allow Terraria.exe through or try disabling your VPN if you are using one.
 4. If that website does not work, the Mod Browser server might be blocked by your Government, Internet Service Provider, Router, or Web Filter. If that is the case, you'll need to figure it out on your own.

tModLoader.MigratePlayersMessage:
You have no players.
If you'd like to migrate your players from vanilla to tModLoader,
please copy them from /Terraria/Players to /Terraria/ModLoader/Players.
Copy the .plr file and the similarly named folder over.
Click me to open those folders.
After copying over the players you want, press back.
tModLoader.MigrateWorldsMessage:
You have no worlds.
If you'd like to migrate your worlds from vanilla to tModLoader,
please copy them from /Terraria/Worlds to /Terraria/ModLoader/Worlds.
Copy the .wld file over.
Click me to open those folders.
After copying over the worlds you want, press back.
